alert.note: Alert for Steele (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 7:57AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Steele, northeastern Waseca and southeastern Rice Counties through 830 AM CDT... At 756 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southeast of Waseca, or 10 miles southwest of Owatonna, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Owatonna and Medford around 810 AM CDT. Faribault around 815 AM CDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 36 and 59. U.S. Highway 14 between mile markers 154 and 177. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for south central and southeastern Minnesota.
